Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Aged Payables Back Dating report categorizes vendor balances into aging buckets. It offers flexibility with filters for different payment terms, aging dates, and custom aging bucket sizes.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Aged Receivable Back Dating report categorizes customer balances into aging buckets. It offers flexibility with filters for different payment terms, aging dates, and custom aging bucket sizes.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: View the number of hours remaining for production allocated to each Work Centre in a specified period. Allows you to determine if a Work Centre is under or overloaded and requires rescheduling.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Average Collection Period report analyses trends in the average collection period over time. It includes supporting details such as the Number of Days, Accounts Receivable, and Accounts Receivable (Average) to provide context and enhance the analysis.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: View the average time spent for Setup, Run and Stop times per unit for each manufactured Item. Expand to see the times for each production order to determine why fluctuations occurred.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Balance Sheet by Month report provides a month-to-month comparative view of the balance at date for balance sheet accounts.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutTitle
Properties.Value: About Bin Contents by Item Tracking

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Bin Contents by Item Tracking report provides a detailed view of warehouse quantities by Item, Location, Bin Code, Zone Code, Lot number or Serial number.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Budget Comparison report presents a month-to-month analysis of Net Change against Budget Amounts for both Balance Sheet and Income Statement accounts. Featuring variance and variance percentage metrics, providing a clear view of how actual performance compares to budgeted targets.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: View your capacity cost variance % viewed over a timeline you can define to see trends. Analyze by each production order and filter by Work Centre to see the detail behind the overall percentages.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: View your consumption cost variance % viewed over a timeline you can define to see trends. Analyze by each production order and filter by Work Centre to see the detail behind the overall percentages.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: View the current Weeks Utilisation % by comparing Capacity Used to Available Capacity in Hours. View all or some Work Centres to measure throughput and efficiency.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Daily Purchases report offers a detailed analysis of purchase amounts by weekday. The tabular report highlights purchasing trends by using conditional formatting to display purchase figures in a gradient from low to high.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Daily Sales report offers a detailed analysis of sales amounts by weekday. The tabular report highlights trends by using conditional formatting to display figures in a gradient from low to high.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Detailed Customer Ledger Entries report provides granular detail about the entries posted to Customer Ledger and Detailed Customer Sub Ledger.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Detailed Vendor Ledger Entries report provides granular detail about the entries posted to Vendor Ledger and Detailed Vendor Ledger.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The EBITDA report focuses on two key profitability metrics: EBITDA and EBIT. These figures are visualized over time to reveal trends, while Operating Revenue and Operating Expenses are also highlighted to provide supporting context for both measures.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: View the total hours scheduled to be performed for each Work Centre Group and/or Work Centre broken down by production order status and production order to analyze your requirement on factory resources.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Finance Report offers a consolidated view of all financial report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Financial Overview provides a snapshot of the organization's financial health and performance. This page displays key performance indicators that give stakeholders a clear view of revenue, profitability, and financial stability.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: View Expected Quantities and Cost vs Actual Quantities and Costs over time, analyze the detail per item and drill down to the Production Order to track where variances are occurring.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Gross Requirement report visualizes Gross Requirements against Projected Available Balance over time, offering a clear view of inventory demands. A table matrix breaks down this data by item, showcasing key metrics like Gross Requirement, Projected Available Balance, and quantities from demand documents (sales orders and purchase return orders).

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: View the historical Utilisation % by comparing Capacity Used vs Available Capacity in Hours viewed over a timeline you can define to see trends. View all or some Work Centres.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Income Statement by Month report provides a month-to-month comparative view of the net change for income statement accounts.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Inventory by Item report provides inventory quantities by item, offering insights into the sources of supply and demand. Helping organizations understand item-level inventory status, manage stock effectively, and make informed decisions about the state of supply and demand.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Inventory by Location report shows inventory quantities by item and by location.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Inventory by Lot Number report displays inventory quantities categorized by lot number, providing detailed insights into specific batches of stock. A decomposition tree enhances this by allowing users to drill down into inventory data, breaking down lot quantities by various dimensions such as location, item category, or vendor.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Inventory by Serial report displays inventory quantities categorized by serial number. The decomposition tree enhances this report by allowing users to drill down into inventory data, breaking down quantities by various dimensions such as location, item category, or vendor.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Inventory Overview report offers a dashboard view of inventory, featuring key elements such as inventory by location, a comparison of inventory balance versus projected available balance, and key metrics like scheduled receipt quantities and gross requirements.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Inventory Report offers a consolidated view of all inventory report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Inventory Valuation by Item report features a Treemap that visualizes ending balance quantities by item category. It also includes a table matrix providing a detailed view of ending balances and showing fluctuations in inventory over the specified period.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Inventory Valuation by Location report features a Treemap that visualizes ending balance quantities by location. It also includes a table matrix providing a detailed view of ending balances and showing fluctuations in inventory over the specified period.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Inventory Valuation Overview dashboard displays the inventory ending balance against the ending balance posted to the general ledger. Inventory value by location is plotted on a bar chart which is supported by inventory metrics such as increase quantity and decrease quantity.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Inventory Valuation Report offers a consolidated view of all inventory valuation report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Item Availability report visualizes Quantity on Hand versus Projected Available Balance over time, helping track inventory trends. A table matrix breaks down this data by item, offering metrics such as Inventory, Projected Available Balance, Gross Requirements, Scheduled Receipts, Planned Order Receipts, and Planned Order Releases. Providing a comprehensive view of item availability, aiding in effective inventory management and planning.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Liabilities report provides a snapshot of liability account balances as of a specific date. It also highlights key performance metrics influenced by liabilities, such as the Debt Ratio and Debt-to-Equity Ratio.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Liquidity KPIs report offers insights into three key metrics: Current Ratio, Quick Ratio, and Cash Ratio. Visualizing these metrics over time, the report makes it easy to track trends and assess the company’s liquidity position.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Manufacturing Report offers a consolidated view of all manufacturing report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Bin Contents report provides a detailed view of item quantities by bin code and location. It includes additional information such as warehouse quantity, pick and put-away quantities, and both negative and positive adjustments, offering a comprehensive overview of bin movements and inventory management within the warehouse.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The General Ledger Entries report provides granular detail about the entries posted to the general ledger.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: View how your released production orders are tracking by comparing Expected Quantity vs Finished Quantity

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: View the percentage of production order time assigned vs Available Capacity for each Work Centre Group and/or Work Centre in a specified period. Allows you to determine if a Work Centre is overloaded and requires rescheduling.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: View your scrap quantities over a timeline you can define to see trends. Analyze further by Scrap Code, Location, Item Categories and by filtering for specific items.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Profitability report highlights Gross Profit and Net Profit, visualizing these metrics over time. It also provides detailed insights into net margins, gross profit margins, and the underlying revenue, cost and expense figures that drive them.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutTitle
Properties.Value: About Project Invoiced Sales by Customer

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Project Invoiced Sales by Customer report details invoiced sales for a project, broken down by customer. It includes key KPIs such as % Invoiced, Billable Invoiced Price, and Billable Total Price, offering a clear view of project invoicing by customer.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutTitle
Properties.Value: About Project Invoiced Sales by Type

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Project Invoiced Sales by Type report details invoiced sales for a project categorized by line type. It includes key KPIs such as % Invoiced, Billable Invoiced Price, and Billable Total Price, providing a clear overview of project invoicing performance and statistics.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Project Performance to Budget report highlights key metrics, including Budget Total Cost, Actual Total Cost, and the variance and percentage variance from the budget. It features a table that details these metrics by project, offering a clear view of cost performance and deviations from budgeted targets.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Project Profitability report displays key metrics such as Actuals and Budgeted KPIs, compares actual profit to the initial profit target, and includes a table view of project ledger entries by type.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Project Realization report features key metrics like Billable Invoice Price and Actual Total Price to support Realization percent per project. Enabling organizations to measure actual performance and achievements against planned or budgeted expectations.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Projects Overview dashboard provides key insights into project performance with metrics like Percent Complete, Percent Invoiced, Realization Percent, Actual Profit, and Actual Profit Margin. It features visuals comparing Actual vs. Budgeted Costs, highlighting Profit per Project, and organizing projects by Project Manager for streamlined project management.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Projects Report offers a consolidated view of all project report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Project Task report details tasks related to each project, with metrics for each task clearly outlined. It presents tasks in a table matrix in a hierarchical view, making it easy to navigate and analyze project task information.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutTitle
Properties.Value: About Purchases Actual vs. Budget Amount

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchases Actual vs. Budget Amount report offers a comparative analysis of purchase amounts against budgeted amounts. It includes variance and variance percentage metrics to clearly show how actual purchases align with budgeted targets.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutTitle
Properties.Value: About Purchase Actual vs. Budget Quantity

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchases Actual vs. Budget Quantity report offers a comparative analysis of purchase quantities against budgeted quantities. It includes variance and variance percentage metrics to clearly show how actual purchases align with budgeted targets.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchase and Sales Quantity report offers insight into inventory movements by visualizing Net Quantity Purchased and Net Quantity Sold across time. The table matrix breaks down purchases and sales by item and item category code, targeting insights into supply from purchases and demand from sales.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchases by Item report breaks down procurement performance by item, highlighting metrics such as Purchase Amount, Purchase Quantity. The Treemap visualizes the relative size and contribution of each item to the whole, making it easy to identify the largest or smallest purchases at a glance.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchases by Location report displays purchase amounts and quantities by location. Including a Treemap to highlight item spending contributions and a bar chart to show purchase amounts by item category.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchases by Purchaser report breaks down purchase amounts by individual purchasers, using a Treemap to visually compare spending contributions by item. A bar chart complements this, displaying purchase amounts for each purchaser. Making it easy to identify top spenders and track procurement patterns.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchases by Vendor report shows purchase amounts and quantities by vendor. Featuring a Treemap for item spending contributions and a bar chart for purchase amounts by item category, offering a clear view of vendor performance and spending patterns.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchases Decomposition report visually breaks down Purchase Amount into its contributing factors, allowing users to explore and analyze data hierarchies in detail.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchases Moving Annual Total report provides a rolling 12-month view of procurement figures, tracking current year to the previous year's performance.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchases Moving Average report visualizes the 30-day moving average of purchase amounts over time. This helps identify trends by smoothing out fluctuations and highlighting overall patterns.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchase Overview provides high level insights into procurement performance, highlighting metrics such as Outstanding Quantities, Quantity Received not Invoiced and Invoice Quantity.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchases Period Over Period report compares procurement performance across different periods, such as month-over-month or year-over-year. Completed up to here

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchases Report offers a consolidated view of all purchases report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Purchases Year-Over-Year report compares purchase amounts across multiple years. This report is essential for long-term planning and making informed decisions based on historical purchasing data.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutTitle
Properties.Value: About Sales Actual vs. Budget Amount

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Sales Actual vs. Budget Amount report provides a comparative analysis of sales amounts to budget amount. Featuring variance and variance percentage metrics that provide a clear view of actual performance compared to budgeted targets.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutTitle
Properties.Value: About Sales Actual vs. Budget Quantity

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Sales Actual vs. Budget Quantity report provides a comparative analysis of sales quantity to budget quantity. Featuring variance and variance percentage metrics that provide a clear view of actual performance compared to budgeted targets.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Sales by Customer report breaks down sales performance highlighting key metrics such as Sales Amount, Cost Amount, Gross Profit and Gross Profit Margin by customer. This report provides detailed insights into which customer and items driving revenue and profitability.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Sales by Item report breaks down sales performance by item category, highlighting metrics such as Sales Amount, Gross Profit Margin, and Gross Profit as a Percent of the Grand Total. This report provides detailed insights into which categories and items are driving revenue and profitability.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Sales by Salesperson report breaks down salesperson performance by customer and item. Highlighting metrics such as Sales Amount, Sales Quantity, Gross Profit and Gross Profit Margin.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Sales Month-to-Date report tracks the accumulation of sales amounts throughout the current month, providing insights into progress and performance up to the present date.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Sales Moving Annual Total report provides a rolling 12-month view of sales figures, tracking the current year to the previous year's performance.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Sales Moving Average report visualizes the 30-day moving average of sales amounts over time. This helps identify trends by smoothing out fluctuations and highlighting overall patterns.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Sales Overview provides a comprehensive view of sales performance, offering insights into metrics such as Total Sales, Gross Profit Margin, Number of New Customers, and top-performing customers and salespeople.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Sales Period Over Period report compares sales performance across different periods, such as month-over-month or year-over-year.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Sales Report offers a consolidated view of all sales report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Shows the Power BI element as full screen.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: The Scheduled Receipt report visualizes Scheduled Receipt against Projected Available Balance over time, offering a clear view of inventory supply. A table matrix breaks this down by item, showcasing key metrics like Scheduled Receipt Quantity, Projected Available Balance, and quantities from supply documents such as purchase orders, transfer receipts and manufacturing documents.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Welcome to the Assisted Setup for Power BI

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: This will guide you through how to connect to Power BI and configure how your data will be displayed.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Choose Next to set up the connector

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Defines which type of calendar the year boundaries are applied to during Date table generation in Power BI. Using Weekly, the first and last day of the year might not correspond to a first and last day of a month, respectively.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the first day of a week and defines when a week starts in a weekly calendar. US calendars typically use 0 (Sunday), whereas European calendars use 1 (Monday)

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies which country to use in order to set the holidays in the calendar as non-working days

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: A standard monthly calendar that begins on January 1 and ends on December 31

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the first month of the Fiscal calendar. If set to 1, the fiscal monthly calendar is identical to the standard calendar.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the first day of a week. US calendars typically use start on Sunday, whereas European calendars start on Monday

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies which country to use in order to set the holidays in the calendar as non-working days

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: A fiscal monthly calendar where the year starts on the first day of a month that is not January

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the starting period for the Fiscal Weekly calendar.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the first day of a week and defines when a week starts in the Fiscal Weekly calendar. US calendars typically start on Sunday, whereas European calendars start on Monday

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies which country to use in order to set the holidays in the calendar as non-working days

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the end of the year definition for the Fiscal Weekly calendar. Last: Last weekday of the month at Fiscal year end. Nearest: Last weekday nearest the end of month.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the number of weeks per period in each quarter. Quarters which always count 13 weeks in the Fiscal Weekly calendar

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: A fiscal weekly calendar that supports: 4-4-5, 4-5-4, or 5-4-4

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the time zone for Power BI related dates.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Defines the UTC time zone in the Power BI date table.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Defines the range of dates to be generated in the Power BI date table. Fields are set automatically based on Accounting Periods. If there are budgets that extend past the last date in the Accounting Periods table, you will need to manually set the Ending Date to accommodate the extended range.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Defines the working days of the week

Properties.Name: ObsoleteReason
Properties.Value: This group is no longer used.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Click here to view the developer documentation.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies which type of calendar the year boundaries are applied to during Date table generation in Power BI. Using Weekly, the first and last day of the year might not correspond to a first and last day of a month, respectively.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the first day of a week and defines when a week starts in a weekly calendar. US calendars typically use 0 (Sunday), whereas European calendars use 1 (Monday).

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies which country to use in order to set the holidays in the calendar as non-working days. A standard monthly calendar that begins on January 1 and ends on December 31

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the first month of the Fiscal calendar. If set to 1, the fiscal monthly calendar is identical to the standard calendar.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the first day of a week. US calendars typically use start on Sunday, whereas European calendars start on Monday.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies which country to use in order to set the holidays in the calendar as non-working days. A fiscal monthly calendar where the year starts on the first day of a month that is not January.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: First Month of Fiscal Weekly Calendar

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the starting period for the Fiscal Weekly calendar.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the first day of a week and defines when a week starts in the Fiscal Weekly calendar. US calendars typically start on Sunday, whereas European calendars start on Monday.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies which country to use in order to set the holidays in the calendar as non-working days

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the end of the year definition for the Fiscal Weekly calendar. Last: Last weekday of the month at Fiscal year end. Nearest: Last weekday nearest the end of month.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the number of weeks per period in each quarter. Quarters which always count 13 weeks in the Fiscal Weekly calendar. A fiscal weekly calendar that supports: 4-4-5, 4-5-4, or 5-4-4.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the time zone for Power BI related dates.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the starting date reference for the Power BI Date table.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the ending date reference for the Power BI Date table.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the Finance Report Name from the Finance App.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies when the last Dimension Set Entry was inserted or modified in the database. To improve performance, the "Update Power BI Dimension Set Entries" job queue entry will retrieve and insert Dimension Set Entry records from this point onwards.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Create a job queue entry that will refresh Power BI Dimension Set Entries in the background. This is required for dimensions to be displayed in Power BI Reports.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the working days of the week.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers a consolidated view of all financial report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides a snapshot of the organization's financial health and performance. This page displays key performance indicators that give stakeholders a clear view of revenue, profitability, and financial stability.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides a month-to-month comparative view of the net change for income statement accounts.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides a month-to-month comparative view of the balance at date for balance sheet accounts.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that presents a month-to-month analysis of Net Change against Budget Amounts for both Balance Sheet and Income Statement accounts. Featuring variance and variance percentage metrics, providing a clear view of how actual performance compares to budgeted targets.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers insights into three key metrics: Current Ratio, Quick Ratio, and Cash Ratio. Visualizing these metrics over time, the report makes it easy to track trends and assess the company’s liquidity position.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that highlights Gross Profit and Net Profit, visualizing these metrics over time. It also provides detailed insights into net margins, gross profit margins, and the underlying revenue, cost and expense figures that drive them.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides a snapshot of liability account balances as of a specific date. It also highlights key performance metrics influenced by liabilities, such as the Debt Ratio and Debt-to-Equity Ratio.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that focuses on two key profitability metrics: EBITDA and EBIT. These figures are visualized over time to reveal trends, while Operating Revenue and Operating Expenses are also highlighted to provide supporting context for both measures.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that analyses trends in the average collection period over time. It includes supporting details such as the Number of Days, Accounts Receivable, and Accounts Receivable (Average) to provide context and enhance the analysis.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that categorizes customer balances into aging buckets. It offers flexibility with filters for different payment terms, aging dates, and custom aging bucket sizes.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that categorizes vendor balances into aging buckets. It offers flexibility with filters for different payment terms, aging dates, and custom aging bucket sizes.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides granular detail about the entries posted to the general ledger.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides granular detail about the entries posted to Vendor Ledger and Detailed Vendor Ledger.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides granular detail about the entries posted to Customer Ledger and Detailed Customer Sub Ledger.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers a consolidated view of all inventory valuation report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that  displays the inventory ending balance against the ending balance posted to the general ledger. Inventory value by location is plotted on a bar chart which is supported by inventory metrics such as increase quantity and decrease quantity.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that features a Treemap that visualizes ending balance quantities by item category. It also includes a table matrix providing a detailed view of ending balances and showing fluctuations in inventory over the specified period.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that features a Treemap that visualizes ending balance quantities by location. It also includes a table matrix providing a detailed view of ending balances and showing fluctuations in inventory over the specified period.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers a consolidated view of all sales report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides a comprehensive view of sales performance, offering insights into metrics such as Total Sales, Gross Profit Margin, Number of New Customers, and top-performing customers and salespeople.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers a detailed analysis of sales amounts by weekday. The tabular report highlights trends by using conditional formatting to display figures in a gradient from low to high.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that visualizes the 30-day moving average of sales amounts over time. This helps identify trends by smoothing out fluctuations and highlighting overall patterns.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides a rolling 12-month view of sales figures, tracking the current year to the previous year's performance.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that compares sales performance across different periods, such as month-over-month or year-over-year.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that tracks the accumulation of sales amounts throughout the current month, providing insights into progress and performance up to the present date.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that breaks down sales performance by item category, highlighting metrics such as Sales Amount, Gross Profit Margin, and Gross Profit as a Percent of the Grand Total. This report provides detailed insights into which categories and items are driving revenue and profitability.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that breaks down sales performance highlighting key metrics such as Sales Amount, Cost Amount, Gross Profit and Gross Profit Margin by customer. This report provides detailed insights into which customer and items driving revenue and profitability.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that breaks down salesperson performance by customer and item. Highlighting metrics such as Sales Amount, Sales Quantity, Gross Profit and Gross Profit Margin.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides a comparative analysis of sales quantity to budget quantity. Featuring variance and variance percentage metrics that provide a clear view of actual performance compared to budgeted targets.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides a comparative analysis of sales amounts to budget amount. Featuring variance and variance percentage metrics that provide a clear view of actual performance compared to budgeted targets.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers a consolidated view of all project report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides key insights into project performance with metrics like Percent Complete, Percent Invoiced, Realization Percent, Actual Profit, and Actual Profit Margin. It features visuals comparing Actual vs. Budgeted Costs, highlighting Profit per Project, and organizing projects by Project Manager for streamlined project management.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that details tasks related to each project, with metrics for each task clearly outlined. It presents tasks in a table matrix in a hierarchical view, making it easy to navigate and analyze project task information.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that displays key metrics such as Actuals and Budgeted KPIs, compares actual profit to the initial profit target, and includes a table view of project ledger entries by type.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that features key metrics like Billable Invoice Price and Actual Total Price to support Realization percent per project. Enabling organizations to measure actual performance and achievements against planned or budgeted expectations.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that highlights key metrics, including Budget Total Cost, Actual Total Cost, and the variance and percentage variance from the budget. It features a table that details these metrics by project, offering a clear view of cost performance and deviations from budgeted targets.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that details invoiced sales for a project categorized by line type. It includes key KPIs such as % Invoiced, Billable Invoiced Price, and Billable Total Price, providing a clear overview of project invoicing performance and statistics.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that details invoiced sales for a project, broken down by customer. It includes key KPIs such as % Invoiced, Billable Invoiced Price, and Billable Total Price, offering a clear view of project invoicing by customer.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers a consolidated view of all manufacturing report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report to view the current Weeks Utilization % by comparing Capacity Used to Available Capacity in Hours. View all or some Work Centres to measure throughput and efficiency.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report to view the historical Utilization % by comparing Capacity Used vs Available Capacity in Hours viewed over a timeline you can define to see trends. View all or some Work Centres.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report to view the percentage of production order time assigned vs Available Capacity for each Work Centre Group and/or Work Centre in a specified period. Allows you to determine if a Work Centre is overloaded and requires rescheduling.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report to view the number of hours remaining for production allocated to each Work Centre in a specified period. Allows you to determine if a Work Centre is under or overloaded and requires rescheduling.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report to view the total hours scheduled to be performed for each Work Centre Group and/or Work Centre broken down by production order status and production order to analyze your requirement on factory resources.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report to view Expected Quantities and Cost vs Actual Quantities and Costs over time, analyze the detail per item and drill down to the Production Order to track where variances are occurring.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report to view your consumption cost variance % viewed over a timeline you can define to see trends. Analyze by each production order and filter by Work Centre to see the detail behind the overall percentages.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report to view your capacity cost variance % viewed over a timeline you can define to see trends. Analyze by each production order and filter by Work Centre to see the detail behind the overall percentages.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report to view the average time spent for Setup, Run and Stop times per unit for each manufactured Item. Expand to see the times for each production order to determine why fluctuations occurred.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report to view how your released production orders are tracking by comparing Expected Quantity vs Finished Quantity

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report to view your scrap quantities over a timeline you can define to see trends. Analyze further by Scrap Code, Location, Item Categories and by filtering for specific items.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Project Invoiced Sales by Type (Power BI)

Actions.Name: Project Invoiced Sales by Type (Power BI)

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Project Invd. Sales by Cust. (Power BI)

Actions.Name: Project Invd. Sales by Cust. (Power BI)

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers a consolidated view of all purchases report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides high level insights into procurement performance, highlighting metrics such as Outstanding Quantities, Quantity Received not Invoiced and Invoice Quantity.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that visually breaks down Purchase Amount into its contributing factors, allowing users to explore and analyze data hierarchies in detail.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers a detailed analysis of purchase amounts by weekday. The tabular report highlights purchasing trends by using conditional formatting to display purchase figures in a gradient from low to high.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that visualizes the 30-day moving average of purchase amounts over time. This helps identify trends by smoothing out fluctuations and highlighting overall patterns.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides a rolling 12-month view of procurement figures, tracking current year to the previous year's performance.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that compares procurement performance across different periods, such as month-over-month or year-over-year. Completed up to here

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that compares purchase amounts across multiple years. This report is essential for long-term planning and making informed decisions based on historical purchasing data.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that breaks down procurement performance by item, highlighting metrics such as Purchase Amount, Purchase Quantity. The Treemap visualizes the relative size and contribution of each item to the whole, making it easy to identify the largest or smallest purchases at a glance.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that breaks down purchase amounts by individual purchasers, using a Treemap to visually compare spending contributions by item. A bar chart complements this, displaying purchase amounts for each purchaser. Making it easy to identify top spenders and track procurement patterns.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that shows purchase amounts and quantities by vendor. Featuring a Treemap for item spending contributions and a bar chart for purchase amounts by item category, offering a clear view of vendor performance and spending patterns.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that displays purchase amounts and quantities by location. Including a Treemap to highlight item spending contributions and a bar chart to show purchase amounts by item category.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers a comparative analysis of purchase quantities against budgeted quantities. It includes variance and variance percentage metrics to clearly show how actual purchases align with budgeted targets.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers a comparative analysis of purchase amounts against budgeted amounts. It includes variance and variance percentage metrics to clearly show how actual purchases align with budgeted targets.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Purch. Actual vs. Budget Qty. (Power BI)

Actions.Name: Purch. Actual vs. Budget Qty. (Power BI)

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Purch. Actual vs. Budget Amt. (Power BI)

Actions.Name: Purch. Actual vs. Budget Amt. (Power BI)

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Sales Actual vs. Budget Qty. (Power BI)

Actions.Name: Sales Actual vs. Budget Qty. (Power BI)

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Sales Actual vs. Budget Amt. (Power BI)

Actions.Name: Sales Actual vs. Budget Amt. (Power BI)

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Bin Contents by Item Tracking (Power BI)

Actions.Name: Bin Contents by Item Tracking (Power BI)

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers a consolidated view of all inventory report pages, conveniently embedded into a single page for easy access.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers a dashboard view of inventory, featuring key elements such as inventory by location, a comparison of inventory balance versus projected available balance, and key metrics like scheduled receipt quantities and gross requirements.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides inventory quantities by item, offering insights into the sources of supply and demand. Helping organizations understand item-level inventory status, manage stock effectively, and make informed decisions about the state of supply and demand.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that shows inventory quantities by item and by location.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that offers insight into inventory movements by visualizing Net Quantity Purchased and Net Quantity Sold across time. The table matrix breaks down purchases and sales by item and item category code, targeting insights into supply from purchases and demand from sales.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that visualizes Quantity on Hand versus Projected Available Balance over time, helping track inventory trends. A table matrix breaks down this data by item, offering metrics such as Inventory, Projected Available Balance, Gross Requirements, Scheduled Receipts, Planned Order Receipts, and Planned Order Releases. Providing a comprehensive view of item availability, aiding in effective inventory management and planning.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that visualizes Gross Requirements against Projected Available Balance over time, offering a clear view of inventory demands. A table matrix breaks down this data by item, showcasing key metrics like Gross Requirement, Projected Available Balance, and quantities from demand documents (sales orders and purchase return orders).

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that visualizes Scheduled Receipt against Projected Available Balance over time, offering a clear view of inventory supply. A table matrix breaks this down by item, showcasing key metrics like Scheduled Receipt Quantity, Projected Available Balance, and quantities from supply documents such as purchase orders, transfer receipts and manufacturing documents.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that displays inventory quantities categorized by lot number, providing detailed insights into specific batches of stock. A decomposition tree enhances this by allowing users to drill down into inventory data, breaking down lot quantities by various dimensions such as location, item category, or vendor.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that displays inventory quantities categorized by serial number. The decomposition tree enhances this report by allowing users to drill down into inventory data, breaking down quantities by various dimensions such as location, item category, or vendor.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides a detailed view of item quantities by bin code and location. It includes additional information such as warehouse quantity, pick and put-away quantities, and both negative and positive adjustments, offering a comprehensive overview of bin movements and inventory management within the warehouse.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Open a Power BI Report that provides a detailed view of warehouse quantities by Item, Location, Bin Code, Zone Code, Lot number or Serial number.
